page.title: 02Scalford
page.content: Scalford is a busy, but pretty Conservation village some 7 kilometres from Melton Mowbray.St Egelwin's is the only church dedicated to him in England. The name Scalford shows there was once a ford here. There is still an underground stream,which is now channelled to a tap by the road called The Spout.This was restored in 1977 for Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee. People now use the water for cars and gardens. The village has four shops, two general food stores, a bakery shop and the post office which also sells newspapers and groceries.There are two pubs, the Plough and several small businesses, including a creamery. Many of the houses are quite old and built of ironstone or Scalford brick, now no longer made, but there are some modern brick built houses.
